iebaker.xenon.slice

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • iebaker.xenon.slice.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Node is a class representing a tree-based layout structure. It exposes functionality to split nodes in various ways to create children. The Node class is the basis of the Slice layout system. To create a new node from an application context, use the constructor which takes an application, a screen, and a String ID. The node, however, needs instruction on how to build itself, so you must also override the build() method of node in place
    Node foo = new Node(parent_application, containing_screen, "foo") {
    public void build(Vec2i newSize) {
    ...set up node layout building...
    }
    }
    More instructions on exactly how to USE the build() method can be found in the description of the Slice class

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(Application owner,
    Screen s,
    java.lang.String id)
        Constructor. This constructor should be used to create the root node in the tree as it pulls its size information from its parent application and sets its position to be (0,0) by default.
        Parameters:
        owner - The parent application
        id - The NodeID of this Node

      • Node

        public Node(java.lang.String id,
    Screen s,
    Node par,
    Vec2f loc,
    Vec2f siz)
        Constructor. This constructor is used mostly by the division methods to produce nodes which have a specific location and size.
        Parameters:
        id - The NodeID of this Node
        par - The parent Node of this node
        loc - A vec2f representing the location of this Node
        siz - A Vec2f representing the dimensions of this LaoyutNode

      • getChild

        public Node getChild(java.lang.String... args)
              throws ChildNotFoundException
        Retrieval method for a single child node indexed by a list of Strings which represent the path through the Node tree to that child. Will throw a ChildNotFoundException if there is no child found along that path at any point.
        Parameters:
        args - The path to the desired child node
        Returns:
        the Node child which was requested
        Throws:
        ChildNotFoundException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The group of children nodes found
        Throws:

      • attach

        public void attach(SliceElement... elems)
        Adds Widgets to this node. They will be given the same location and width as this node.
        Parameters:
        elems - The SliceElements to be added

      • flatten

        public void flatten(java.lang.String s)
        Makes all children of children of this node direct children of this node. AKA it does what you think flatten() should do. The names of the new nodes created are assigned by appending the IDs of nodes along the path to that node (separated by an input string).
        Parameters:
        s - A string used to separate the appended names of the children

      • divide

        public java.util.List<Node> divide(Slice slice)
        Divides nodes
        Parameters:
        slice - the slice to be performed

      • divideBasic

        public java.util.List<Node> divideBasic(Slice.D d,
                               java.lang.String prefix,
                               java.lang.Float[] splits,
                               java.lang.String[] names,
                               java.lang.Float p)
        Basic division method to create child nodes either horizontally or vertically which split the parent node according to specific floating point cutoffs.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which to perform the split
        prefix - An optional prefix to add to the names of all nodes
        splits - The locations at which to divide the parent node
        names - An optional list of names to give the nodes (if not provided, they are assigned numerically)
        p - An optional padding to place between the newly created nodes.
        Returns:
        A java.util.List of all child nodes created by this call

      • divideEvenly

        public java.util.List<Node> divideEvenly(Slice.D d,
                                java.lang.String prefix,
                                java.lang.String[] names,
                                java.lang.Integer n,
                                java.lang.Float p)
        Division method which is given either a number of nodes to make, or a list of names (both doesn't really make sense...) and creates child nodes which split the direction of division evenly.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which to perform the split
        prefix - An optional prefix to add to the names of all nodes
        names - An optional list of names to give the nodes (if not provided, they are assigned numerically)
        n - An integer number of nodes to create.
        p - An optional padding to place between the newly created nodes
        Returns:
        A java.util.List of all child nodes created by this call

      • divideFloating

        public java.util.List<Node> divideFloating(Slice.D d,
                                  java.lang.Float minP,
                                  java.lang.Float[] sizes,
                                  java.lang.String prefix,
                                  java.lang.String[] names)
        Division method which is given a set of sizes of nodes to create and distributes them evenly among the space available in that direction.
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which to perform the division
        minP - An optional minimum padding between the nodes created
        sizes - The sizes of the nodes to be created
        prefix - An optional prefix to give to the names of the nodes created
        names - A list of names for the nodes (if not provided, they are assigned numerically)
        Returns:
        A java.util.List of all child nodes created by this call

      • divideBlocks

        public java.util.List<Node> divideBlocks(Slice.D d,
                                java.lang.Float[] sizes,
                                java.lang.String prefix,
                                java.lang.String[] names,
                                java.lang.Float p)
        Division method which is given a set of sizes of nodes to create, and slides them to one side of the space available
        Parameters:
        d - The direction in which to perform the division
        sizes - A list of sizes of nodes to create
        prefix - An optional prefix to give to the names of all child nodes
        names - A list of names to give the noes (if not provided, they are assigned numerically)
        p - An optional padding to put between the nodes
        Returns:
        A java.util.List of all child nodes created by this call
